column4: i'm trying to get an ov5642 camera to work with ubuntu.  when i searched for a driver, i found this website: http://boundarydevices.com/blogs/camera-driver-example-code  i went and downloaded the kernel that was mentioned in the previous blog post, but i could not successfully make it.  is this the right approach?
yeah, i plug it in through my usb port
does it load ok in logs?
i'm pretty new, which logs should i check?
maybe it already works, do you have vlc installed?
i don't have vlc installed, but i tried going to chat roulette and the ov5642 camera didn't show up as an option.

yea thats cause linux will not allow you to have even less of a life by going there. but in the meantime install vlc, then click on Media-OPen Capture device and under capture mode see if your camera is there
when i'm looking for those log files you mentioned, would they be in /var/log ?
yes those but if you go to System->Adminis->log file viewer its easier (top bar)
in the log files unplug and replug the camera and watch the bottom lines of the file
it's showing up....but it's talking about a "bidirectional printer"
*the log file refers to a bidirectional printer
ov5642.  the best information i found was on this site, look at this blog post and the previous one: http://boundarydevices.com/blogs/camera-driver-example-code
yea it looks as if the driver is not yet in the kernel (must be very new camera) either attempt what it says on the page (got to know its very technical) or wait a couple of months
do you know someone who would be experienced with that?  and i looked in vlc, all i see in there is video for linux 2, pvr, dvb, and desktop.
